page.title: 18TRANSPORT IN THROWLEY
page.content: There has been no public transport in Throwley for several years. The two hourly bus service from Ashford to Faversham can be caught at Leaveland corner, 25 minutes walk away. The journey to Faversham takes about ten minutes. Very few people from the village travel this way. In the village 3 families do not have a car, and in 7 families there is only one driver. These people without transport go to Faversham only once a week and often rely on the neighbours. A taxi journey into town costs Â£4 one way. A baker from Ospringe delivers bread in the area, while the milkman, who calls 5 days a week, also sells a range of groceries. A mobile shop (grocery and greengrocery) calls once a week. A "Help the Aged" minibus picks up elderly people on Wednesdays.
